column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to James A.H. Murray''' (grandson of [[Wikipedia:James Murray (lexicographer)|Sir James A.H. Murray]] of the ''[[Oxford English Dictionary]]'').<ref name=CG>{{CG|C}}
Merton College Oxford (on headed paper of 19 Lakeside Road
column4: headed "Private and confidential".<ref name=TL>[http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/pcollier/DSC00002.htm Tolkien Library Store - Rare Tolkien Items] at [http://www.tolkienlibrary.com Tolkienlibrary.com] (accessed 22 March 2011)</ref>

column3: Private Press & Children's Books 12 December 2002'' (p. 239).<ref name=CG/>

column1: ''if you would like to visit me in my guarded rooms in 21 Merton Street... I should love to see you'' and notes "''...I could show you some pictures & a tapestry associated with 'The Lord of the Rings' and some other things which might interest you...''". Tolkien explains that his rooms in Merton Street are guarded since "''...it was arranged that my living there was not to be known; but since it became known
column2: I have been assailed by hosts of people
column6: so that I live behind locked doors
column7: and under the eye of the local C.I.D. Which all sounds romantic
column8: but is in fact an infernal nuisance. But I should of course arrange for you to pass the barrier ... the college to protect me!''"<ref name=TL/>
